#Text=Canada 's York West ( Ward 7 ) city council candidates speak
#Text=Monday , October 30 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontoians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is York West ( Ward 7 ) .
#Text=One candidate responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Sandra Anthony , Fred Cutler , Giorgio Mammoliti ( incumbent ) , and Larry Perlman .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Larry Perlman
#Text=42-year-old Larry Perlman is a self-employed equities trader .
#Text=Q : Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A :
#Text=1. The perception and reality of crime in Ward 7 that has resulted in feelings of discomfort in our communities .

#Text=By initiating a Neighbourhood Watch in my community and eventually connecting all the Neighbourhood Watches within the Ward , I hope to show residents that by participating in their own communities they can make a difference .
#Text=2.
#Text=A lack of connection between residents to their communities , the communities to the Ward , and the residents and communities in the Ward to their local Councillor .
#Text=By establishing 10 community committees and having one representative from each community part of a Ward committee , I will help connect the residents of Ward 7 together .
#Text=3. Voter apathy and cynicism to the political process that has resulted in low voter turnout and the lack of pride in their communities .
#Text=A goal of 50 % voter turnout within 8 years is one of the visions in my campaign .
#Text=Q : What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?

#Text=A : Connecting the residents and communities in Ward 7 together will be the most effective means of identifying the Ward 's " quality of life " issues , which will then be used to find the best solutions that can be solved together .
#Text=Q : Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=A : In the last 3 years living in Ward 7 , I have noticed a void in effective leadership from the incumbent Councillor .

#Text=I took it upon myself to fill that void by getting involved in community organizations , finding solutions to Ward-area problems , and providing City Council committees with ideas that would benefit the City as a whole .
#Text=My accomplishments are reason enough to go to the next level -- Councillor .
#Text=Q : Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=A : My wife and I moved into Ward 7 a little more than 3 years ago ( our first home ) .
#Text=We have a close connection with our neighbours , and as Councillor I would like to make things better in my community .
#Text=Q : How are you currently involved in the community ?

#Text=A : I have participated in a number of organizations and initiatives in my community , including the establishment of a Neighbourhood Watch and participation in the Humber Summit Community Resource Centre .

#Text=I virtually eliminated illegal pocket bike use in the Ward , minimized garbage dumping in various areas in my community , established speed humps and a review of the City 's traffic-calming policy , and voiced my opposition to excessive aircraft noise coming from Pearson Airport .
#Text=Please go to my website for more accomplishments and initiatives that I have undertaken and will undertake in the future .
#Text=Q : What does Toronto mean to you ?
#Text=A : Toronto is my hometown .
#Text=It is the City I was born in , raised in for many years and the City I have chosen as my home and place to work after finishing University .
#Text=I met and fell in love with my wife here , bought a home here and intend on raising my family here .
#Text=Q : Which council decision ( since the 2003 election ) do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?

#Text=A : The decision to react strongly to the " year of the gun " last summer by recruiting more Police and putting more money into youth programs was the best decision the City made for our Ward ( and the City as a whole ) .
#Text=There is still more work to do , as the perception and reality of crime is still around us , but the situation is much better than last year .
#Text=The least desirable decision by City Council was the pay raise given to themselves earlier this year .
#Text=It was not deserved and resulted in negative feelings towards our City representatives and cynicism among the residents of Toronto towards the political process .
#Text=Q : If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , What would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?
#Text=A : Passion , Persistence and Fresh Ideas !

#Text=As a " rookie " , I would not be settling in my position as Councillor , but would be actively bringing new ideas to the table , searching for the best solutions for the Ward , and representing the needs and wants of the residents of Ward 7 with energy and determination .
#Text=I have shown this with my accomplishments , my promises , my future initiatives and my vision , as stated clearly on my website .
#Text=No other candidate for Ward 7 Councillor ( including the incumbent ) can say the same thing .
